Class Millipede

java.lang.Object
  SimObject
      Millipede

public class Millipede
extends SimObject

This class holds the data for each individual millipede segment.

Nested Class Summary
private static class Millipede.DIRECTION
          Enum of the direction that the Millipede is traveling in.
private static class Millipede.MOTION
          enum of the Vertical motion the Millipede is travelling in.

Field Detail

M_KILL_POINTS

public static final int M_KILL_POINTS
points for killing a millipede

See Also:
Constant Field Values

M_MAX_SPEED

private static double M_MAX_SPEED
Max speed that the Millipede can travel at.

Caution if you reset this to more than 1. there may be issues at the edges of the landscape

M_VERTICAL_STEP

private static double M_VERTICAL_STEP
Max vertical speed when switching direction.

direction

private Millipede.DIRECTION direction
This is the direction that a given Millipede is travelling in

motion

private Millipede.MOTION motion
This holds the direction that each particular Millipede is heading in. UP means that it is moving up the board. DOWN means moving down the board.

isAlive

private boolean isAlive
Boolean of whether the Millipede is alive or not True means that it is, false it is dead.

Constructor Detail

Millipede

public Millipede(double x,
                 double y)
This constructor method creates a Millipede at the given position (x,y). The direction will initially be right and down and it will be alive.

Parameters:
x - - x location of the Millipede
y - - y location of the Millipede
Method Detail

kill

public void kill()
This kills the Millipede segment, i.e. sets isAlive field to false

toString

public String toString()
This returns a string representation of the Millipede object. This just returns the string value of it's x position

Overrides:
toString in class Object
Returns:
x position as a string

isAlive

public boolean isAlive()
This returns whether the Millipede is alive

Returns:
true if alive, false otherwise

updateState

public boolean updateState(Landscape scape)
Description copied from class: SimObject
Updates this object's state based on the local neighborhood of the Landscape.

Specified by:
updateState in class SimObject
Parameters:
scape - the Landscape the agent lives on
Returns:
true if the object survives updating its state, false if it does not

checkBoundary

private boolean checkBoundary(Landscape scape)
This method checks to see if the Millipede element has reached the edge of the landscape going in either direction it will return false if the Millipede is trying to move off of the landscape

Parameters:
scape - Landscape the game is being played on
Returns:
true if the Millipede is free to move, false if it is at an edge of the Landscape

checkMove

private boolean checkMove(Landscape scape)
This method will check to see if there are any obstacles in the path of the millipede. If there are obstacles in the way it will return false

Parameters:
scape - - landscape we are playing on
Returns:
false if there is an obstacle in the way, true otherwise

draw

public void draw(Graphics g,
                 int x,
                 int y,
                 int scale)
Description copied from class: SimObject
Draws this object on a Graphics object. The point (x, y) specifies the position of the object in screen coordinates. The scale specifies the size of a single unit of land.

Specified by:
draw in class SimObject
Parameters:
g - the Graphics object to draw to
x - the x position in screen coordinates
y - the y position in screen coordinates
scale - the size in pixels of a single unit of land
